title: Calories in Fried Catfish Fillet
meta_description: Discover calories in fried catfish fillet, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per serving, and preparation tweaks for healthier options.
assumptions: Breaded with cornmeal batter, deep-fried in vegetable oil; standard 100g fillet portion; no added sauces or sides.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fish size, breading type, oil used, frying time, and portion; check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One fried catfish fillet (100g) contains about 220 kcal and 18 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Baked instead of fried (no added oil)

faqs.q: How many calories in one fried catfish fillet?
faqs.a: Approximately 220 kcal for a standard 100g breaded and fried fillet.

faqs.q: What's the protein in fried catfish fillet?
faqs.a: About 18 g protein per 100g serving, making it a good lean source.

faqs.q: Does frying catfish add a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, frying adds about 12 g total fat per fillet, mostly from oil absorption.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in fried catfish?
faqs.a: Around 10 g carbs per fillet, primarily from the breading or batter.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in fried catfish fillet?
faqs.a: Opt for baking, air-frying, or lighter breading to cut 80-100 kcal per serving.
